answers.answer: Dear Kathy,Diabetic women are at an increase risk of heart disease and often do not experience pain.  Your mother's doctor is doing the right thing to evaluate her for heart disease.  It is likely that she will have some evidence of coroanry disease given her diabetes and her age.

question: I am interested to know if the signs/symptoms for a woman having a heart attck are the same or similar to a mans'?  My mother, age 74, is experiencing skipped heart beats.  She has always skipped one kind of regularly, but recently they have increased to three or more at a time.  Her physician is sending her for a 2D Echo, a Thalium Stress, and an EKG.  She is also diabetic.  Do skipped beats have to indicate a more serious problem?Thank you for your time.Kathy
title: Skipped heart beats
